column4: i'm trying to get a crontab job going here is what i have the entry 00 4 * * * /home/goldenpod/goldenpod-0.6/goldenpod -s
by /var/log/syslog it appears to start the job
but it never seems to really execute
can you execute "/home/goldenpod/goldenpod-0.6/goldenpod -s" manually?
yea
try it. make sure.
yep it still runs
check with "sudo ps -A" if it is running after the cron job has executed it.
if it doesn't, check the script. it might be trying commands in the wrong directory.
here is what i get 25925 pts/0    00:00:01 goldenpod
ok, it is executed fine.
what are you expected to see, what is the script supposed to do?
it's a podcast aggregator
so it produces a file and you can't find it, that's it?
check in the /root directory
the directory is there but there is no files in there
did you use "crontab -e" or "sudo crontab -e"?
both
where does the script say it downloads to then? can you set that option on the command in cron?
it should download to a directory in /home/shared/torrent/Podcast
what is -s option for goldenpod ? the manpage for it does not list it
ah, silent
so check the log for goldenpod
